definition: to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)

sentences.english: Terrorist scenarios previously considered far-fetched suddenly became operative presumptions.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖情景以前认为牵强成了部分假设。

sentences.english: Not far fetched to say you love me, anyway, my soul has patches of litter.
sentences.chinese: 你也不必牵强再说爱我，反正我的灵魂已片片凋落。
这听上去是否太牵强了？

sentences.english: Well,it may not be so farfetched.
sentences.chinese: 那么，它可能不那么牵强。
他的笑话有些牵强附会。

sentences.english: The film is spoilt by unrealistic contrivances of plot.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影被不实际的牵强情节给毁了。

sentences.english: Besides, the conclusion may seem no less far-fetched if we easily amplify the boundary of results.
sentences.chinese: 另外，选一个点实验就推大结论，也有些牵强。

sentences.english: That is an equality too far.
That's how one developer explained his reluctance to pair program.
sentences.chinese: 这就是某个开发者对结对编程的牵强解释。

sentences.english: The novel has a very contrived plot.
sentences.chinese: 这本小说有非常牵强附会的情节。

sentences.english: In this connection, Li Shangyin's poems allow no farfetched comparison or realistic interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 李商隐的诗不可牵强比附，去做指实的说解。

sentences.english: That's not as far-fetched as it sounds.
Well, it may not be so farfetched.
sentences.chinese: 是的，它实际上没有那样的牵强。

sentences.english: He lugged the subject into his speech.
sentences.chinese: 他把那话题牵强地扯进演讲中。

definition: to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
